     214             : 
     215             :   /**
     216             :    * Schedules an update of the frame's bounds (which will in turn invalidate
     217             :    * the new area that the frame should paint to).
     218             :    *
     219             :    * This does nothing when passed an NS_FRAME_IS_NONDISPLAY frame.
     220             :    * In future we may want to allow ReflowSVG to be called on such frames,
     221             :    * but that would be better implemented as a ForceReflowSVG function to
     222             :    * be called synchronously while painting them without marking or paying
     223             :    * attention to dirty bits like this function.
     224             :    *
     225             :    * This is very similar to PresShell::FrameNeedsReflow. The main reason that
     226             :    * we have this function instead of using FrameNeedsReflow is because we need
     227             :    * to be able to call it under nsSVGOuterSVGFrame::NotifyViewportChange when
     228             :    * that function is called by nsSVGOuterSVGFrame::Reflow. FrameNeedsReflow
     229             :    * is not suitable for calling during reflow though, and it asserts as much.
     230             :    * The reason that we want to be callable under NotifyViewportChange is
     231             :    * because we want to synchronously notify and dirty the nsSVGOuterSVGFrame's
     232             :    * children so that when nsSVGOuterSVGFrame::DidReflow is called its children
     233             :    * will be updated for the new size as appropriate. Otherwise we'd have to
     234             :    * post an event to the event loop to mark dirty flags and request an update.
     235             :    *
     236             :    * Another reason that we don't currently want to call
     237             :    * PresShell::FrameNeedsReflow is because passing eRestyle to it to get it to
     238             :    * mark descendants dirty would cause it to descend through
     239             :    * nsSVGForeignObjectFrame frames to mark their children dirty, but we want to
     240             :    * handle nsSVGForeignObjectFrame specially. It would also do unnecessary work
     241             :    * descending into NS_FRAME_IS_NONDISPLAY frames.
     242             :    */

     392             : 
     393             :   enum BBoxFlags {
     394             :     eBBoxIncludeFill           = 1 << 0,
     395             :     eBBoxIncludeFillGeometry   = 1 << 1,
     396             :     eBBoxIncludeStroke         = 1 << 2,
     397             :     eBBoxIncludeStrokeGeometry = 1 << 3,
     398             :     eBBoxIncludeMarkers        = 1 << 4,
     399             :     eBBoxIncludeClipped        = 1 << 5,
     400             :     // Normally a getBBox call on outer-<svg> should only return the
     401             :     // bounds of the elements children.  This flag will cause the
     402             :     // element's bounds to be returned instead.
     403             :     eUseFrameBoundsForOuterSVG = 1 << 6,
     404             :     // https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getBoundingClientRect
     405             :     eForGetClientRects         = 1 << 7,
     406             :   };
     407             :   /**
     408             :    * This function in primarily for implementing the SVG DOM function getBBox()
     409             :    * and the SVG attribute value 'objectBoundingBox'.  However, it has been
     410             :    * extended with various extra parameters in order to become more of a
     411             :    * general purpose getter of all sorts of bounds that we might need to obtain
     412             :    * for SVG elements, or even for other elements that have SVG effects applied
     413             :    * to them.
     414             :    *
     415             :    * @param aFrame The frame of the element for which the bounds are to be
     416             :    *   obtained.
     417             :    * @param aFlags One or more of the BBoxFlags values defined above.
     418             :    * @param aToBoundsSpace If not specified the returned rect is in aFrame's
     419             :    *   element's "user space".  A matrix can optionally be pass to specify a
     420             :    *   transform from aFrame's user space to the bounds space of interest
     421             :    *   (typically this will be the ancestor nsSVGOuterSVGFrame, but it could be
     422             :    *   to any other coordinate space).
     423             :    */
     424             :   static gfxRect GetBBox(nsIFrame *aFrame,
     425             :                          // If the default arg changes, update the handling for
     426             :                          // ObjectBoundingBoxProperty() in the implementation.

     429             : 
     430             :   /*
     431             :    * "User space" is the space that the frame's BBox (as calculated by
     432             :    * nsSVGUtils::GetBBox) is in. "Frame space" is the space that has its origin
     433             :    * at the top left of the union of the frame's border-box rects over all
     434             :    * continuations.
     435             :    * This function returns the offset one needs to add to something in frame
     436             :    * space in order to get its coordinates in user space.
     437             :    */

     480             :   /**
     481             :    * Compute the maximum possible device space stroke extents of a path given
     482             :    * the path's device space path extents, its stroke style and its ctm.
     483             :    *
     484             :    * This is a workaround for the lack of suitable cairo API for getting the
     485             :    * tight device space stroke extents of a path. This basically gives us the
     486             :    * tightest extents that we can guarantee fully enclose the inked stroke
     487             :    * without doing the calculations for the actual tight extents. We exploit
     488             :    * the fact that cairo does have an API for getting the tight device space
     489             :    * fill/path extents.
     490             :    *
     491             :    * This should die once bug 478152 is fixed.
     492             :    */
